page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT- A FIREWOMAN
page.content: Miss Manning decided to become a firewoman because in the newspaper there were lots of reports saying that there were not enough firemen in Northleach and because of that the station would have to close down. She thought that she could do the job, applied and was put on a course for one month to train to become a firewoman. She was not teased by the men because she was one of two women at Northleach fire station. They get called out about 12 times a month and about 90 times a year. She has driven the fire engine but she had to take a special test for heavy goods vehicles. The worst fire she had been to was a tractor fire. When they do go to fires they have to wear special breathing apparatus.
